description.value:
Trigger A creature attempts to move through the tar

Effect A scalding burst of hot tar burns the creature, which must immediately attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:28] save.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes [[/r 3d6[fire]]] damage.

Failure The creature takes [[/r 6d6[fire]]] damage and [[/r 1d6[persistent,fire]]] damage.

Critical Failure The creature takes [[/r 9d6[fire]]] damage, [[/r 2d6[persistent,fire]]] damage and takes a -10-foot status penalty to its Speed as long as it continues to take the persistent fire damage from the hot tar clinging to it.

stealth.details: (the tar lake is blatantly obvious, and its effects occur near the end of each round)

details.description: The bubbling tar churns and seethes, periodically bursting in a burning hot splatter of scalding sludge and gas.
details.disable: @Check[type:survival|dc:30] check to throw rocks or other bits of debris into areas within the tar lake that are about to burst, allowing the lake to vent harmlessly for that round (on a critical success, this prevents the lake from venting for 3 rounds); permanently disabling the tar pit would require powerful magic or long-term engineering projects (subject to the GM's discretion).
details.routine: (1 action) The bubbling lake of tar churns and sputters. One randomly determined target within 5 feet of the tar lake is targeted by a Scalding Burst.
